message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with text summarization, which is a natural language processing task. Additionally, the paper proposes a reinforcement learning framework for text summarization, which falls under the category of machine learning. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the generalization of state-of-the-art models on other datasets, which is related to information retrieval, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a self-critic policy gradient approach, which is a type of reinforcement learning, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category as well.
